Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2008 02:26PM qutypy wrote: Hi, I am scheduled to see the plastix surgeon on the 6th of Jan. Then surgery very soon after. I will be having a bilateral with reconstruction ( I think). I was diognosed with DCIS last Friday and have already seen the breast surgeon. original plan was a lumpectomy, radiation and bilateral mastectomy in June, but It will make me crazy till then, so I hope to forgo the lumpectomy and head straight to the other. Face the dragon as a friend put it. So off I go.... Good luck to you, and I hope we can stay in touch. Carla
Posts.Title: January Mastectomy crusader1 bettelou68

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2009 08:37PM qutypy wrote: I thought I heard them all, when a ditz I play maj jong said  " oh, do you think you got it from your implants??"  That just sealed the deal for me and her.....I have heard the most insipid, insensitive comments. I love the one about getting new boobs. I want my old ones back! The ones that are squishy and need an underwire bra....I realize some people just don't know what to say, I appreciate  that, I really do, but some people are just plain stupid....
Posts.Title: Stupid Comments About Upcoming Mastectomy Shanagirl Kitt09

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2009 02:57PM qutypy wrote: Hi Diamond I had a bilateral MX after a diagnosis of DCIS late December. I had immediate reconstruction and am now recovering nicely 3 weeks post op.I decided not to do the BRCA test yet. I have no family history of breast cancer but decided to be done with any "what if's " I am very happy with my decision. I researched it to death and decided the odds of a recurrence were too high for my comfort level.
Posts.Title: Bilateral Mastectomy DiamondGurl Superwoman808
